alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Crenshaw; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 6:31AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Butler, northeastern Monroe, Crenshaw and northeastern Conecuh Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 628 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Beatrice, or 14 miles north of Evergreen, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Luverne, Georgiana, Brantley, McKenzie and Rutledge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central Alabama.
